comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: I'm guessing this guy, who died on the Lusitania: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Frohman

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The NYT of May 24, 1915 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F70E15FA385C1373... said that the funeral would be at his brother's home and Temple Emanu-el The NYT of May 26, 1915 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F10C14FB385C1373... described the "great outpouring of men and women of the theatre at the funeral services of Charles Frohman yesterday."

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The Temple Emanu-el's timeline www.emanuelnyc.org/timeline.php indicates that this would be a temple at 43rd St and Fifth Avenue, built in 1868 and used until 1927. See daytoninmanhattan.blogspot.com/2012/03/lost-1868-temple-e... for more about the building, including its demolition.
